newsitem.title: USA: Sonoco sees $1 bln capital spending plans.
newsitem.headline: Sonoco sees $1 bln capital spending plans.

text.p: Sonoco Products Co said on Tuesday it would spend over a billion dollars on capital projects between 1995 and 2000, compared with about $670 million in the preceding six years.

The company said it had numerous expansion programs aimed at increasing capacity and productivity in several businesses, including an expansion of the infrastructure at its seven-inch paper mill in Hartsville and a two billion bag capacity expansion at its Indiana plastic bag plant.
Sonoco said about 80 percent of its revenue comes from its domestic operations, but it is commited to its international customers.

"Sonoco has many customers, located in more than 85 countries, who are expanding their products internationally," said Peter Browning, president and chief operating officer. "These international plant infrastructure, productivity, market leadership and experience make us a company they can turn to for management of their total packaging supply chain."
Because of its large domestic business, the company said it would have to grow these operations to meet its goal of doubling the company's size from the 1994 base.
The majority of this growth would be internal, Browning said. The pressure sensitive label business would be one of the most important growth areas for the domestic operations, he said.
